sections.title: Section C: Health Facility Microscopy Readiness

subSections.title: C.1 Staffing Levels

inputRows.label: 1.Is this facility a PHCU,DISPENSARY, PRIVATE CLINIC,FBO CLINIC

If yes:
 Are there at least two (2) Laboratory Technician available at this lab?
2.Is this facility a DISTRICT HOSPITAL,COTTAGE, MILITARY?

If yes: 
 Are there at least four(4) Laboratory Technicians available at this lab?
Is this facility a REFERAL HOSPITAL ?

If yes: 
Are there at least ten (10)Laboratory Techinician available at this lab?

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Determine the number of staff members present on the day of the visit for the facility depending on its level. Note: Minimum staffing level: PHCU, Dispensary, Private Clinic, FBO Clinic – 2 Lab personnel; Minimum staffing level:  District Hospital, PHCC/Cottage, Military – 4 Lab personnel; Minimum staffing level: Referral Hospital-10 Lab personnel.

subSections.title: C.2 Staff training

inputRows.label: Total number of Lab Technician employed at this facility that perform microscopy
How many laboratory practitioner have received formal (centralized) training on malaria microscopy
How many laboratory practitioner have received On Job training (mentorship) on malaria microscopy?
SUB-SCORE: C.2 Staff training level score

subSections.instruction: Instruction:Supervisor, enquire about staff who have received microscopy training

subSections.title: C.4 Laboratory Set-up and Safety

inputRows.label: Dedicated room for malaria microscopy(spacious and well ventilated)

Fire extinguisher 
(Instruction: At PHCU+ level, score YES if the facility has a fire extinguisher not necessarily allocatein in the laboratory)
SUB-SCORE: C.4 Laboratory set up safety

subSections.title: SECTION C.:Health Facility Microscope Readiness Score

inputRows.label: C.7 Malaria Microscope data collection tool readiness
SCORE: Section C. Microcopy Readiness Score

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Calculate Total Section Score by averaging  section Scores

subSections.title: D.1 Specimen Collection

inputRows.label: Arrange the required materials for slide sample collection
Label slide sample correctly using appropriate labels?
Collect blood sample by finger prick
Register patient ID number and date?
Prepare a thick and thin smear on a clean slide

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Observe the microscopist performing blood slide that is sample collection, fixation, staining, examination, and interpretation. If a facility has more than one microscopists observations should be made to different microscopists.If there is only one microscopist then all observations should be done on that microscopist. If there is no patient for observation, simulation can be done.

subSections.title: D.2 Fixation and Staining of Blood Films

inputRows.label: Does this facility use a Giemsa? If response is No, skip the rest of section D
Did the health provider do the following?
For thin blood smear fixes by spraying methanol for 1 second?
For thin blood smear, dries fixed slide smear in the air for 10 minutes before staining?
Prepares buffered water and Giemsa stain solution (working condition)?
Floods each slide and stain for the appropriate time (10 min. Count after flood 1st slide)?
Gently washes the slide starting with the 1st flooded slide?
Keeps the slide in the rack to air-dry?
SUB-SCORE: D.2 Fixation and Staining of Blood Films

subSections.instruction: Instruction: Observe the microscopist performing blood slide that is sample collection, fixation, staining, examination and interpretation. If a facility has more than one microscopist observations should be made to different microscopists. If there is only one microscopist then all observations should be done on that microscopist. If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used.

subSections.title: D.3 Preparation of Stain

inputRows.label: Did the health provider do the following?
Giemsa stain stock solution labeled with opening date and time
Giemsa stain stock solution kept well-stoppered in dark place
pH of buffer used for dilution is 7.2.
Diluted Giemsa discarded immediately after use

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used

subSections.title: D.4 Slide Staining

inputRows.id: Did the health provider do the following?

inputRows.label: Slides are clean and not scratched.
Slide drained and dried on the rack or Slide warm
No heating used to dry films

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used

subSections.title: D.5 Slide Examination

inputRows.label: Did the health provider do the following?
Immersion oil placed on a slide
Stage of microscope racked down before placing the slide
Focus with x 10 or x40 objective before focus with x100 oil immersion objective

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used

subSections.title: D.6 Slide Reading

inputRows.label: Negative result differentiated from a positive result
200 fields examined before declaring slide negative
Parasite density quantified >10 by counting 200+ white blood cells
If the number of parasites is <10 after counting 200 WBC then continue to count up to 500+ WBC
Parasites reported according to species level

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.7 Result Reporting

inputRows.label: Result reported as negative, where appropriate
If positive, parasite density reported as the number of parasites per microlitre of blood and malaria parasites species
Date and time of result recorded
Turnaround time of slide preparation and reading met (1 hour)
Result filled on the patient health record book and recorded in the laboratory register

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.8 Slide Cleaning and Slide/Microscope Storage

inputRows.label: Slides placed on kitchen paper to remove oil
Positive and negative slides stored separately in slide boxes to allow selection of slides for cross-checking.
SUB-SCORE: D.8 Slide Cleaning & Microscope storage

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

sections.title: Section D. Microscopy Observations: Score

inputRows.label: D.2 Fixation & Staining of Blood Films
D.8 Slide Cleaning and Slide/Micro storage

sections.instruction: Instructions: Calculate Total Section Score by averaging section Scores (N= number of observations)

sections.title: SECTION E. Quality Assurance & Quality Control

inputRows.label:
Does the facility receive prepared and stained blood smears? 
 (If no complete the rest of the section by answering No)
Has the facility received any blood slides panel for EQA in the last six months? Verify
Did the facility examine the PT slides?
Are results of the PT entered in the log book? Verify
Does the facility retain a copy/record of results? Verify
Does the facility review results from the PT provider? Verify
Are results in agreement with verifier? Verify
Does the verifier record results in log sheet? Verify
Does the verifier provide coaching? Verify
Does the facility do corrective actions in case of result discrepancy? Verify
Does the facility store stained blood films for external quality monitoring?
Are 10% of negative blood films and all positive blood films picked randomly and sent to the ZAMEP reference laboratory for second reading?
Are the results of cross checked blood films entered in to the log sheet?Verify
Does the facility do corrective actions in case of result discrepancy?
Does the facility perform IQC malaria blood slides daily?
Are the results reported in a log sheet by two readers daily?
Does the facility performed weekly internal assessment and pick two random blood films daily and filled in a log sheet? Verify

subSections.title: Section E.: Quality Assurance Score
subSections.instruction: Instructions: Calculate Total Section Score by averaging  section Scores

subSections.title: F.1. Laboratory Malaria Register Data Consistency Check

inputRows.label: End time of the supervision visit

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Choose the most previous three-month data from Malaria register and National malaria case register for positive cases. Laboratory Register, NMCR and write the values in each of the blank squares. Compare the values A and B as directed in the table below. Give 2 point for each of the matching numbers.
